channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Large pothole outside 1 Malvern Lodge, Malvern Place, 5th April
item.description:
Large pothole outside 1 Malvern Lodge Malvern Place here for several weeks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 19 Regent Street, Cheltenham

item.title: Fly posting along PE Way by Edinburgh place, 5th April
item.description:
Can somebody take him down please and prosecute the perpetrators

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Tasmania House Princess Elizabeth Way, Cheltenham

item.title: Very deep and dangerous potholes - directly under the traffic lights, 5th April
item.description:
Very large and deep pothole right next to the traffic island where the lights are. The potholes are forcing cars to move out into the next lane, just as the road narrows past the traffic island. I have also seen cars swerving towards the traffic island to try and avoid. Very dangerous.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 6 Hatherley Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 30 inch pothole on Cudnall Street, at T junction by house number 1., 5th April
item.description:
I previously reported this pothole to you (your Enquiry Number: 11407545). I received an email from you yesterday saying that it had been repaired. It has not been touched, the attached photos were taken today. The pothole continues to get bigger and is a significant danger to road users there.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 1 Cudnall Street, Charlton Kings
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 40 inch pothole on Cudnall Street, next to houses 20 & 22, 5th April
item.description:
I have previously reported this pothole to you (your Enquiry Number: 11407542). I received an email from you yesterday saying that the work has been completed. It has not been touched, the attached photographs were taken today. This pothole is now some 6 inches deep and is a positive danger to all road users there.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 18 Cudnall Street, Charlton Kings
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mud and debris on the road, 5th April
item.description:
Street cleaning team required. The road outside the Landers has a curb that is so built up with mud you can not see it. This mud then gets taken down the road and into the drains.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Little Gungs Close Ermin Way, Witcombe
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pathway maintenance required, 5th April
item.description:
The pathway is now very difficult to pass in places and pushes pedestrians into the road a mud natural debris from the bank is blocking the path. This path has not been maintained in at least 3 years and is now very unsafe for pedestrians on such a busy road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Pasederas Ermin Way, Witcombe
Report on FixMyStreet

Can someone come and pick it up please?

item.title: Massive pothole, 4th April
item.description:
On inner lane heading towards Gloucester. Very dangerous as hole is so huge you have to swing right out into outer carriageway.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Hatherley House Hatherley Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 5 Potholes, 4th April
item.description:
Come on……. There is a stretch along this road which is TERRIBLE and DANGEROUS. It’s next to a school and also close to a bus stop. Today your lot have been out and filled a few of the potholes but left many there. I suggest you try driving down that stretch of road and see how appalling it is. It makes little difference that you’ve filled a few of the potholes. You need to resurface a complete section of that road. These photos were taken at 5.30pm tonight just about 15 metres from where you’ve filled a few holes today. What a total waste of time and money to only do half a job. This stretch needs totally resurfacing. It’s dangerous. The potholes in photos are over 75mm deep. The ones you’ve not filled at the bus stop also need relooking at as it’s like a farm track (actually it’s worse than a farm track). What hope do elderly etc have of crossing the road safely once they’ve got off the bus. Come on Gloucestershire Highways, sort it out. It’s a disgrace.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 1 Peel Close, East End
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Severely deteriorating road surface, 4th April
item.description:
The road surface is breaking up and is very uneven and bumpy at the junction of Sandford Mill Road and Old Bath Road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 28 Old Bath Road, Cheltenham

item.title: Series of potholes, 4th April

Several potholes along Sandford Road in front of the hospital near College Lawn
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 1 College Lawn, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Parking, 4th April
item.description:
Hello For the last few years we have had a major issue with our neighbours who run a child minders from their home. They insist on allowing their customers to persistently block our drive and garage access. They have gone so far as to tell their customers that they own our driveway and to ignore our complaints. This is a business operating out of a residential home causing years worth of issues for all of their neighbours. Is there nothing that you can do? I have dozens of photographs as evidence if needed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 35 Medoc Close, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Almost unusable footpaths, 4th April
item.description:
The footpaths running from Coombe Hill to The Leigh on the A38 are almost unusable. I struggled with the pushchair. They're very uneven, have large potholes, are covered in mud and grass and have brambles protruding out from the hedges. The verges have almost taken over the path in some places.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Hillview Cottage A38, Coombe Hill
Report on FixMyStreet
